intro: Pterocephalus bretschneideri, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture. The flowers bloom in summer and are often used in traditional Chinese medicine.
